metadata.titel_preek: At Calvary: Two Words At The End

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The cosmic journey of Jesus from Bethlehem to Calvary to complete the divine plan of redemption and return to the Father.

subject.identificatie: Jesus (The Son of God / The Dying Savior)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus... made from Bethlehem to Calvary
he moved on some painful and sacrificial road
The mighty warrior untenses his muscles

object.identificatie: Redemption / The restoration of lost children to the Father
tekstueel_bewijs: to win us back to the Father's house
restore lost and alienated daughters and sons
lift the awful load of sin from the world

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Receiver (initially), then Subject (transition at the end)

helper.identificatie: The Prophets / The Spirit of Consecration
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Sender and the Goal (Father's house).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the 'high and holy consecration'.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The sermon describes sin as a power that ruins families and lives, and Hell as a combatant that 'lost' the battle.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's imitation of Christ's 'I must' to achieve a finished life and a peaceful death.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / 'We'
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A finished life / Entrance into heaven
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher transitions from what Christ did (Program 1) to what we must do (Program 2) as a mirroring response.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Father → Salvation → The Lost Child

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus therefore had received the vinegar
The mighty warrior untenses his muscles

voorbeelden: I must be about my Father's business
I must, we must... must serve on
divine plan to win us back
Jesus was aware of his purpose
saw himself more and more clearly reflected

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon moves from Christ's 'Pouvoir' (it is finished) to the hearer's 'Devoir' (we must serve on).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Lost) to S1 (Finished) via Christ's performance, then back to ~S1 (the hearer's current 'must') aiming for S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in Christ's 'shout' of victory which opens the highway.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described through vivid social and personal ruin.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is overwhelmingly theocentric in its description of the atonement. While it ends with a call to duty, this duty is framed as a participation in the 'words' Christ has already validated.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Subject-switch to hearer in the conclusion
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We will never be able to say, 'It is finished'... until we say, 'I must.'

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the sole actor in salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: At Calvary, God's ancient intention... is now an accomplished deed.
Hell has lost; God has won.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus's 'I must' becomes the template for the believer's 'I must'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The believer's 'must' is not a condition for the 'finished' work, but a fruit of it.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Assurance followed by a sense of vocational urgency.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification is monergistic, but the 'good death' is presented as somewhat synergistic.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from Christ's work to the believer's life is handled through the linguistic bridge of the 'Two Words'.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'It is finished' (Christ) and 'We will never be able to say it is finished until we...' (Hearer).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The battle is fought; the victory is won... Hell has lost; God has won.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Son's work; the Spirit's role in the 'must' is implied but not stated.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is an 'awful load' and a cause of total social disintegration.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: God (in the cosmic sense), Man (in the biographical sense).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative of salvation. The shift to the hearer as Subject in the final third is hortatory but risks creating a new 'law' of finishing one's own work.

subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Ensure the 'we must' is clearly grounded in the 'It is finished'.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Because He said 'It is finished,' His 'must' now carries our 'must' to the finish line.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer identifying as the one who must 'finish' their own spirit.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the one whose spirit is already 'commended' in Christ.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that our 'must' is a participation in His, not a separate requirement.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir (Must) at the end.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (Power) via the Holy Spirit.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Mention the Spirit as the one who enables the 'must'.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats sin and hell as serious cosmic opponents.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses narrative movement to ground human experience in the finished work of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'shout' and the imagery of the warrior, Greimasian analysis reveals that the 'warrior' is the Subject who changes the status of the 'lost child' (Receiver).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek 'tetelestai'; semiotics focuses on how that word functions as a 'Performance' that completes a 'Mandate' from the Sender.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'Subject-switch' in the final paragraphs where the hearer is recruited into the 'I must' role originally occupied by Jesus.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'I must' of the boy Jesus as a modal anchor for the 'It is finished' of the dying Jesus.
